title: Google Associate Cloud Engineer (ACE) Practice Exam
description: This practice exam covers key concepts for the Google Associate Cloud Engineer certification.

questions.question: Which Google Cloud service is best suited for running containerized applications?
questions.hint: Think about services specifically designed for container orchestration.
questions.explanation: Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) is a managed environment for deploying, managing, and scaling containerized applications using Google infrastructure. It's the best choice for running containerized applications on Google Cloud.

questions.question: Which of the following are valid ways to interact with Google Cloud Platform? (Select all that apply)
questions.hint: Consider both graphical and command-line interfaces, as well as programmatic access.
questions.explanation: Google Cloud Platform can be interacted with through multiple interfaces: the web-based Google Cloud Console, the command-line gcloud CLI, programmatically via REST APIs, and through Cloud Shell, which is an in-browser command-line interface.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) in Google Cloud?
options: To provide a way to run virtual machines
To create an isolated network within Google Cloud
To manage user access and permissions
To store and retrieve object data
correctAnswer: To create an isolated network within Google Cloud
questions.hint: Think about network isolation and security in cloud environments.
questions.explanation: A Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) provides a way to create an isolated, private network within Google Cloud. It allows you to define your own IP address range, create subnets, and configure firewall rules, offering network-level isolation for your cloud resources.
